comment.author: 92581505@N02
comment._content:
Mount Eliza is better know today as 'Kings Park'.
The expanse of water directly between the photographer and Mount Eliza is now artificially reclaimed land. (draw a line in your head to the lone tree you see on the waters edge, everything to the right of that was reclaimed).

comment.author: 92583739@N07
comment._content: On the headland to the lft, the Old Mill is visible. The stretch of water between Mount Eliza (Kings Park) and Mill Point in South Perth is now connected by the Narrows Bridge.

comment.author: 92584555@N07
comment._content: Base of Spring St, Perth showing Mounts Bay and Mount Eliza, pre1890. The  cleared land for the Volunteers' Rifle Range on the top of Mount Eliza can be clearly seen.
